I checked the account and repo status for you.

What I found
- Repository: alicemiller/sorting_searching
- Invitation status: there is a pending collaborator invitation for emma.johnson@bluesparrowtech.com
- I checked the GitHub-linked unread email inbox and there are no unread GitHub invitation emails.

Why you might not see the accept link
- The invite email may have gone to spam or another email address/alias.
- The invite email may have been archived or already read.
- Some GitHub notifications also appear on the GitHub notifications/invitations pages rather than as an unread email.

Next steps you can take (I can help with any of these)
1. Check your personal inbox (including Spam/Junk and any alternate email addresses you use with GitHub) for an invitation from "noreply@github.com". Click the "Accept invitation" link in that email.
2. On GitHub, check your Invitations/Notifications:
   - https://github.com/notifications (invitations often appear here)
   - https://github.com/settings/repositories or https://github.com/settings/repository_invitations (your repository invitations)
3. If you can't find the email or the invite page is empty, ask Alice (repo owner) to re-send the invitation or to add you again. If you want, I can draft an email to Alice requesting a re-send — tell me her email or confirm you want me to draft it and I’ll send it.

If you want, I can:
- Re-scan other inboxes if you give me which email/account to check.
- Draft and send a re-invite request email to Alice (you’ll need to provide her email or let me know to use a known one).
- Walk you through the GitHub Invitations page step-by-step and accept if you paste the invite link here.
